result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas J. Hewitt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any AODA,  counseling/treatment per agent.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes:

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Thomas J. Hewitt in court with attorney Debra V O'Rourke.  Linda A Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.

Count 1:
2 years Probation
60 days SCJ, w/work release, consecutive to any other commitment/sentence. Commence on or before Aug. 1, 2014 @ 6 pm
DNA surcharge $250/sample
Undergo any counseling per agent.
AODA & treatment
$268.00 C/C  & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION)

Count 2:  Dismissed but read in
Paperwork handed in court.
Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 3
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 2, 2014 at 11:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 29, 2014 at 11:00 am.

14R 007329
No possession of controlled substances w/o valid Rx
cash bond modified to $750 from $1500.00 and all other conditions remain

Pre-trial conference on April 11, 2014 at 10:15 am.
Return date on April 22, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Thomas J. Hewitt appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Sue M. Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant does qualify.    Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  State request $1500.00 cash bond with conditions.  Attorney ORourke request signature bond.  No warrant history.  Objection to no contact with premises.  Time limits waived.  $1,500.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No possession of controlled substances unless valid Rx.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 11, 2014 at 10:15 am.  Return date scheduled for April 22, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
